page.title: 01COPPENHALL HOUSE FARM
page.content: The farm dates from Georgian times, and work on building it was finished on the 29th June 1796. The current owners still have the original document for the house. For hundreds of years the farm was like any other, happily going about its business. However, in 1923 something rather disastrous occurred, namely an outbreak of Foot and Mouth Disease. At that time the farm employed some sixty people, and rather than have them idle, the owner, a Mr. Kettell, ordered the construction of a silo. The silo is rather unusual since it has a battlement top. The current owners have cleaned up the silo, painted it white, and put a flag on top of it. They are as yet undecided as to what they will do with it.
